definition: surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
those with lofty ideals (idiom)/men of vision

sentences.english: Hope that every patriotic Patriots, with three seconds of the time you paste, copy.
sentences.chinese: 希望每一位爱国义士，用你们3秒的时间粘贴，复制。

sentences.english: He was a chivalrous person, but was more like a loyal minister.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个义士，但更是一位忠臣。

sentences.english: Herdsmen, I say, but they call themselves the good and just.
sentences.chinese: 我说是牧人，可他们自称为善人和义士。

sentences.english: James Menzies and His Collection of Chinese Art. Shandong University Press, 2000;
sentences.chinese: 明义士和他的藏品，山东大学出版社。

sentences.english: Chief of the General Staff Soong Chang-chih presides over the rank- conferring ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 参谋总长宋长志上将主持范义士授阶典礼。

sentences.english: What is the Chinese Government's official position on Ahn Joong-keun?
sentences.chinese: 请问中国政府现在对于安重根义士的正式立场是什么？

definition: those with lofty ideals (idiom)/men of vision
to meet with disaster/killed/in the clutches of the enemy/to fall foul of/in danger
to sacrifice one's wealth to save the state (idiom)
to sacrifice oneself in a just cause/a victim of a disaster
